column4: sorry, ignore that. use this one: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsbAdslModem/ueagle-atm

the eagle is problematic. I used it in Mandrake 8.2 (that was a long time ago) and it hasn't improved much. I would recommend to see in the french channel (#ubuntu-fr) and/or buy a cheap DSL modem or even a DSL router. Less headache.
the french used it quite a bit a few years back
I havd tried a BT Voyager 105 too with whatever driver that was, that wouldnt even sync - it just failed... I can't find my old Speedtouch
I have a router, but the point of this is to drop the connection entirely onto my server
if you have a router, how do you use the eagle usb modem?
when I *try* to get the modem working, I unplug the router
if you have a router you cannot use a usb modem together. non-usb-modem <-> router <-> computer
I know, I want to eliminate the need for the router.
ah. you found a bad replacement for it :)
Unless I can find some good (PCI?) ADSL modem that will work under Ubuntu
I recommend a stand alone DSL modem. Ethernet connected. You set up the connection settings in the modem, set your computer up for DHCP and  and off you go.
Isn't that really what the router does :/
sorry I misunderstood. I thought you had a router without a modem in it.
I do have another router (that I do like), but I think it got overpowered once and the ADSL modem in that might actually be blown
